title: Enacts provisions relating to tuition assistance program awards for certain students who have been granted an exclusion of parental income
summary: Enacts provisions relating to tuition assistance program awards for certain students who have been granted an exclusion of parental income.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3510

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced   by   M.   of   A.   GLICK,   CANESTRARI,  WRIGHT,  MILLMAN,
         PEOPLES-STOKES, LUPARDO, NOLAN --  Multi-Sponsored  by  --  M.  of  A.
         ABBATE,  GALEF, HEASTIE, JAFFEE, LANCMAN, MAGEE, MARKEY, PAULIN, PHEF-
         FER, REILLY, SWEENEY, WEISENBERG -- read  once  and  referred  to  the
         Committee on Higher Education

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the education law, in relation to tuition assistance
         program awards

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Clause (A) of subparagraph (i) of paragraph a of subdivi-
    2  sion 3 of section 667 of the education law, as amended by section  1  of
    3  part B of chapter 60 of the laws of 2000, is amended to read as follows:
    4    (A) (1) In the case of students who have not been granted an exclusion
    5  of  parental  income,  HAVE BEEN GRANTED AN EXCLUSION OF PARENTAL INCOME
    6  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FOUR OF SECTION SIX HUNDRED SIXTY-THREE OF  THIS
    7  PART,  or  had  a  dependent for income tax purposes during the tax year
    8  next preceding the academic year for which application is made:
    9    (a) For students first receiving aid after  nineteen  hundred  ninety-
   10  three--nineteen  hundred  ninety-four and before two thousand--two thou-
   11  sand one, four thousand one hundred twenty-five dollars; or
   12    (b) For students first receiving aid in nineteen hundred ninety-three-
   13  -nineteen hundred ninety-four or earlier, three  thousand  five  hundred
   14  seventy-five dollars; or
   15    (c)  For students first receiving aid in [the] two thousand--two thou-
   16  sand one and thereafter, five thousand dollars.
   17    (2) In the case of students receiving awards pursuant to  subparagraph
   18  (iii) of this paragraph.
   19    (a)  For  students first receiving aid in nineteen hundred ninety-four
   20  --nineteen hundred ninety-five and nineteen  hundred  ninety-five--nine-
   21  teen  hundred  ninety-six  and  thereafter,  three  thousand twenty-five
   22  dollars, or

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05948-01-1

       A. 3510                             2

    1    (b) For students first receiving aid in nineteen hundred  ninety-two--
    2  nineteen  hundred  ninety-three and nineteen hundred ninety-three--nine-
    3  teen  hundred  ninety-four,  two  thousand  five  hundred   seventy-five
    4  dollars, or
    5    (c)  For students first receiving aid in nineteen hundred ninety-one--
    6  nineteen hundred ninety-two or earlier, two thousand four hundred  fifty
    7  dollars; or
    8    S 2. Subparagraph (iii) of paragraph a of subdivision 3 of section 667
    9  of the education law, as amended by section 1 of part B of chapter 60 of
   10  the laws of 2000, is amended to read as follows:
   11    (iii)  For students who have been granted exclusion of parental income
   12  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION THREE OF SECTION SIX HUNDRED SIXTY-THREE OF THIS
   13  PART and were single with no dependent for income  tax  purposes  during
   14  the  tax  year next preceding the academic year for which application is
   15  made, the base amount, as determined in subparagraph (i) of  this  para-
   16  graph, shall be reduced in relation to income as follows:

   17  Amount of income                    Schedule of reduction
   18                                      of base amount

   19  (A) Less than three thousand        None
   20      dollars
   21  (B) Three thousand dollars or       Thirty-one per centum of
   22      more, but not more than ten     amount in excess of three
   23      thousand dollars                thousand dollars
   24    S 3. Subparagraph (iii) of paragraph b of subdivision 3 of section 667
   25  of  the education law, as amended by chapter 309 of the laws of 1996, is
   26  amended to read as follows:
   27    (iii) For students who have been granted exclusion of parental  income
   28  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION THREE OF SECTION SIX HUNDRED SIXTY-THREE OF THIS
   29  PART  and  were  single with no dependent for income tax purposes during
   30  the tax year next preceding the academic year for which  application  is
   31  made,  the  base amount, as determined in subparagraph (i) of this para-
   32  graph, shall be reduced in relation to income as follows:

   33  Amount of income                    Schedule of reduction
   34                                      of base amount

   35  (A) Less than three thousand        None
   36      dollars
   37  (B) Three thousand dollars or       Thirty-one per centum of
   38      more, but not more than ten     amount in excess of three
   39      thousand dollars                thousand dollars
   40    S 4. Subparagraph (iii) of paragraph c of subdivision 3 of section 667
   41  of the education law, as added by chapter 83 of the  laws  of  1995,  is
   42  amended to read as follows:
   43    (iii)  For students who have been granted exclusion of parental income
   44  PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION THREE OF SECTION SIX HUNDRED SIXTY-THREE OF THIS
   45  PART and were single with no dependent for income  tax  purposes  during
   46  the  tax  year next preceding the academic year for which application is
   47  made, the base amount, as determined in subparagraph (i) of  this  para-
   48  graph, shall be reduced in relation to income as follows:

   49  Amount of income                    Schedule of reduction
   50                                      of base amount
   51  (A) Less than one thousand          None

       A. 3510                             3

    1      dollars
    2  (B) One thousand dollars or         Twenty-six per centum of the excess
    3      more, but not more than five    over one thousand dollars
    4      thousand six hundred sixty-
    5      six dollars
    6    S 5. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to tuition assistance program awards
